contest-event.event-date: Oct. 11, 1969 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship High Peak Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Prizes: 1st: 200 2nd: 150 3rd: 75 4th: 50 The winning band was declared World Champions as well as National Champions of Great Britain. Each player in the winning band received an inscribed medal. The winning conductor was given a Baton of Honour. The Spotlight on Service was given to Alexander Thain. The Insignia of Honour was awarded to Derek Garside. The Excelsior Band came from Kloetinge in Holland. May 18, 2010, 2:07 p.m. Oct. 14, 2011, 3:11 p.m. 1 Brighouse and Rastrick Band Walter B.
